title: Enough is Enough! Fire the Cops Who Killed Daunte Wright
subtitle: Here’s what we know: Police officers in Brooklyn Center, a Minneapolis suburb, shot and killed Daunte Wright during a traffic stop on Sunday, April 11. An unnamed police officer shot a gun into Daunte’s car, and his car then hit another vehicle. A passenger in Daunte’s care was injured, and Daunte was pronounced dead at the scene.

title: Demand a free and fair trial.
subtitle: George Floyd should still be alive today. Demand Justice. Derek Chauvin will stand trial for the murder of George Floyd in March. The 3 other officers on the scene that day will stand trial in August. Chauvin has been charged with second-degree murder and manslaughter and faces up to 40 years in prison if convicted.

title: Support the King Center
subtitle: The King Center remain committed to proactively educating and training individuals and leaders across all sectors in Nonviolence365 to influence equitable change in our national and global infrastructure.

title: Demand Justice for Casey Christian Goodson Jr
subtitle: On Friday, December 4th, 23 year-old Casey Christian Goodson Jr, was shot three times in the back and murdered by police. They mistook his subway sandwich for a gun. Sign this petition to demand justice.

title: Justice for Jacob Blake
subtitle: Jacob Blake is a loving father of 6 that deserves proper medical attention and legal representation. The funds raised through this Gofundme will go toward Jacob’s medical bills, family expenses, legal representation, support for his children and therapy costs.

title: Support the Milwaukee Freedom Fund
subtitle: The Milwaukee Freedom Fund is extending support to protestors in Kenosha, WI. Their mission is to build on ongoing bail abolition efforts, support immigration efforts, work towards Black and Brown Liberation, and support Black and Brown young people as they build a new world.

title: United Negro College Fund
subtitle: UNCF envisions a nation where all Americans have equal access to a college education that prepares them for rich intellectual lives, competitive and fulfilling careers, engaged citizenship and service to our nation.

title: Support the Equal Justice Initiative
subtitle: Your contribution is critical to efforts to end mass incarceration and excessive punishment in the United States, challenge racial and economic injustice, and protect the basic human rights for the most vulnerable people in American society.

title: American Civil Liberties Union
subtitle: Donate to the ACLU. The ACLU has been at the center of nearly every major civil liberties battle in the U.S. for over 100 years. This vital work depends on the support of ACLU members in all 50 states and beyond.

title: Know Your Rights Camp
subtitle: Colin Kaepernick's organization's mission is to advance the liberation and well-being of Black and Brown communities through education, self-empowerment, mass-mobilization and the creation of new systems that elevate the next generation of change leaders.

title: Register to Vote
subtitle: Register to vote to make your voice heard and make sure the people we elect to positions of power have the best interests of every American in mind.

title: Donating Tip
subtitle: Maximize your impact by making smaller, monthly donations to a few different organizations.
info: Don't just let your donations be a one-time lump sum donation. Instead, spread the love out with smaller, recurring, monthly donations to continue supporting the movement beyond your first donation.

title: Black Lives Matter
subtitle: We appreciate your support of the movement and our ongoing fight to end state-sanctioned violence, liberate Black people, and end white supremacy forever.

title: Free Minds Book Club
subtitle: Change lives today. Donate now to support incarcerated and formerly incarcerated youths and adults.

title: Center for Policing Equity
subtitle: Your donation fuels our ability to lead on the police reform that's necessary. Together we will create a public safety system that protects and preserves justice for all.

title: The Bail Project
subtitle: The Bail Project™ National Revolving Bail Fund is on a mission to combat mass incarceration and reshape the pretrial system in the United States. 100% of online donations are used to bring people home. Since bail money comes back to us when cases close, we're able to recycle every dollar donated at least twice per year.

title: Liberation Library
subtitle: Young people in the jails and prisons we serve are experiencing a loss of programming and in-person family visits, leading to further isolation during these uncertain times. We believe it is now more important than ever for incarcerated young people to have access to other worlds of their choosing.

title: Innocence Project
subtitle: Donate to help free the innocent in 2020. Be a part of the Innocence Project’s groundbreaking work to free innocent people and transform the legal system. With your support, we can do even more in 2020 — donate today.

title: The Collective PAC
subtitle: The Collective is strengthening our democracy by addressing the significant underrepresentation of the Black community in public office. We are fighting for equal representation and protection under the law so it is vital that we have Black candidates run, and Black voices heard.

title: Color of Change
subtitle: Color Of Change was founded in moments just like this one. As Black communities reeled in grief as all levels of government failed to protect Black people in the wake of Hurricane Katrina, we recognized that not enough of the people and institutions with power over our lives had any fear of disappointing Black people. For the last 15 years, we've focused on building that power.

title: NAACP Legal Defense and Education Fund
subtitle: Through litigation, advocacy, and public education, LDF seeks structural changes to expand democracy, eliminate disparities, and achieve racial justice in a society that fulfills the promise of equality for all Americans. LDF also defends the gains and protections won over the past 75 years of civil rights struggle and works to improve the quality and diversity of judicial and executive appointments.

title: National Bail Out
subtitle: National Bail Out is a Black-led and Black-centered collective of abolitionist organizers, lawyers and activists building a community-based movement to support our folks and end systems of pretrial detention and ultimately mass incarceration. We are people who have been impacted by cages — either by being in them ourselves or witnessing our families and loved ones be encaged. We are queer, trans, young, elder, and immigrant.

title: Build for Black Lives
subtitle: Are you an anti-racist designer, developer, data scientist, or marketing specialist interested in committing to pro bono projects to work towards reparations and racial justice? Work on one of our available projects.

title: Charge the cops who shot Jacob Blake
subtitle: Jacob Blake, 29, was shot by Kenosha, Wisconsin police officers in the back 7 times on August 23, 2020. Officers were on the scene due to a fight, which Jacob Blake was trying to break up. The cops who shot him need to be charged.

title: Support our Young Protest Leaders #freetianna
subtitle: On Tuesday, July 21, Tianna Arata was arrested by San Luis Obispo PD at about 8 p.m. near Mitchell Park as she and other demonstrators were loading up a car after the protest had already dispersed.

title: Justice for George Floyd
subtitle: Reach the attention of Mayor Jacob Frey and DA Mike Freeman to beg to have the officers involved in this disgusting situation fired and for charges to be filed immediately.

title: The Minneapolis Police Officers to be charged for murder after killing innocent black man
subtitle: Stand up to the Minneapolis Police Department and demand that both officers are charged with murder and sentenced to the highest possible amount of time in Federal prison.

title: #JusticeforBre: Police officers who killed Breonna Taylor must be FIRED.
subtitle: Call for the three police officers responsible for the death of Breonna Taylor to be fired and charged for murder.

title: Fight for Breonna
subtitle: Breonna survived the frontlines of a pandemic that disproportionately kills Black people, only to have her life stolen by police. Take Action.

title: Defund12.org
subtitle: Email and mail government officials and council members to reallocate egregious police budgets towards education, social services, and dismantling racial injustice.

title: Justice for Julius Jones
subtitle: Julius Jones is on death row in Oklahoma, despite maintaining his innocence and compelling evidence that he was wrongfully convicted. Send an email to express your support of his release.

emailInfo.subject: Justice for Julius Jones
emailInfo.messageBody:
Dear Oklahoma Pardon & Parole Board members,

I strongly feel that Julius Darius Jones (# 270147) was wrongfully convicted of murder and sentenced to death in 2002. A crime for which he has always maintained his innocence.

Jones, a black 19 year old man, was arrested in 1999 for shooting white insurance executive Paul Scott Howell in Edmond, Oklahoma. At the time of his arrest, Julius was a successful athlete and honor student on scholarship at the University of Oklahoma.

Recently, new evidence of racial bias in the Jones’ case has been uncovered by the ABC documentary, “The Last Defense.”

One day after the documentary finale aired (7-25-18), the Oklahoma Criminal Court of Appeals released a document indicating they could take a look at the Jones’ case.

There are many factors that were overlooked and never presented during the Julius Jones trial.
1. Jones’ attorney during the trial was inexperienced by his own admission and this was his first death penalty case.
2. Several key pieces of evidence were never presented to the jury.
3. Tunnel vision set in and the police and prosecutor ignored evidence pointing to others as the shooter.
4. The court ignored an alleged racial statement made by one of the jurors
5. The jury judged Jones based on his race.
After viewing the recent ABC documentary, “The Last Defense,” I am even more convinced than ever of Julius’ innocence and that he should be given a new trial. I also ask that District Attorney David Prater release Julius Jones’ case files to his attorneys in order to promote public trust in both the criminal justice system and in Julius Jones’s case.

We all have all heard the phrase ‘beyond a shadow of doubt.’ To me, there is more than a shadow of doubt in this case.

Please, I ask that you do whatever is within your power to support Julius Jones’ Clemency Petition and see that this injustice – the wrongful conviction of Julius Jones – is overturned.

Thank you,
[Your Name]
[Your location]

title: Ban or Restrict Tear Gas
subtitle: The use of tear gas has been banned and is illegal in war. This same tear gas is used by the law enforcement, to control unarmed crowds protesting for the BLM movement. Tear gas is also used for border control and is thrown at innocent migrants who are unarmed and pose no sudden threat to anyone in the vicinity.

title: Reopen Sandra Bland's Case
subtitle: Sandra Bland was arrested for a traffic stop on July 10, 2015 by Brian Encinia.  She was found dead in her cell three days later. Encinia was never indicted, in spite of the fact, that he physically assaulted her her on camera. There is a new video that has come to light, which may have been hidden from the grand jury.

title: Classify White Supremacist Groups as Domestic Terrorist Organizations
subtitle: Request a new legal requirement to register, classify, and subsequently surveil white supremacist organizations as domestic terrorist organizations. By classifying these groups as intimidating to the American population and dangerous to human life, the institutions responsible for protecting citizens against such groups will have the necessary information and resources to prevent further destruction carried out by these violent terrorist groups.

title: Justice for the Murder of Rayshard Brooks
subtitle: Rayshard Brooks, an unarmed, 27 year old Black man was murdered after 3 officers responded to complaints of him sleeping in his vehicle in the Wendy’s parking lot. After struggling with the officers, Brooks began to run for his life, when he was shot in the back more than once.

title: End Police Militarization and Over-Policing
subtitle: The tragic and unnecessary killings of George Floyd, Breonna Taylor, Tony McDade – and countless Black people at the hands of law enforcement – confirms what we've known for too long: Lawmakers must take serious action to fix the racist policing systems in our country.

title: Abolish Prison Labor in the USA
subtitle: Prison labor is a form of modern American slavery used by multiple large corporations across the world. Under the 13th Amendment to the United States Constitution, slavery was merely reformed rather than abolished. Racial justice in the USA cannot be achieved until prison labor is abolished completely.

title: Justice for Tete Gulley
subtitle: Tete Gulley was a 31 year old queer Black transient. She was also known by some of her family as Otis. She was found hanging from a tree on the evening of May 27th 2019 in Rocky Butte Park. The cause of death was determined to be suicide at the scene but there is evidence of foul play.

title: Justice for Dominique Fells
subtitle: June 9th, another black trans woman named Dominique Fells was murdered and thrown in a river. The violence against black trans women needs to stop. We cannot allow for the murder of this young woman to go unpunished.

title: Justice for Lakeith Smith
subtitle: Lakeith Smith, now 20, was charged with the murder of his friend, A’Donte Washington when he was only 15— a crime he did not commit. A'donte died at the hands of a policeman, after the police fired 4 rounds into him - and he currently walks free.

title: Justice For Tony McDade
subtitle: Tony McDade was a transgender black man who got killed by police in Tallahassee. Sign this petition and encourage others to do so as well to get his name out there.
